item.title: Ticket #3427 ($category_cache format change (regression?)) updated
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description:
Take a look at what I'm doing here:

​http://dev.wp-plugins.org/browser/articles/trunk/articles.php?format=txt

Line 100-125 or so. I need to loop through the post/cat relationships. I'm trying to use the tools given to me by core, but making the plugin be 2.0.x and 2.1.x compatible is a bit tricky.

I'm not sure how the APIs help here. What would really help would be to have an array of categories as a property of each post, but I think I've rung that bell to death already. :)

item.title: Ticket #3428 (Moving thumbnail in editor breaks URL) created
item.dc:creator: tagesk
item.description:
Using Firefox on Windows, writing a post, selecting an image, set "using thumb" and "link to image", and after having "Send image to editor", using the "Image button" to set the image to the left, adding a few lines of text above the image, and then moving the image to the top breaks the URL.

The WordPress site is at www.../test so the image is at .../test/wp-content/uploads but after being moved the URL ends up as .../wp-content/uplods. That is, the prefix is dropped as part of the moving. The net result is that the thumb appears on the published page, but when you click on the thumb you receive a freiendly 404 Not Found.

item.title: Ticket #3427 ($category_cache format change (regression?)) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
invalid:

Actually, yes, now that I look, there appears to be API for everything that's changed. I was thinking of the $comment_count_cache which doesn't have an API, but hasn't changed.

Alex, unless you can come up with a case where the current API for these isn't sufficient (get_category(), get_post() etc and wp_cache_set()), I think this can be closed.

item.title: Ticket #3427 ($category_cache format change (regression?)) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: The caches are not really public. Do we not have API for what you want to do?

item.title: Ticket #3427 ($category_cache format change (regression?)) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Owner, Status changed

Looks like that changed here: [4524], and it looks like it was intentional. I can't think of a clean way to fix backward compat (and keep this change) off the top of my head. We could have two cache vars (one for 1, one for non-1), but that's ugly.

'course, we're already breaking some backwards compat with 2.1, so better to break many things at once instead of a little at a time.

Ryan?

item.title: Ticket #3427 ($category_cache format change (regression?)) created
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description:
In 2.0.x, $category_cache is an array of post_id arrays with category objects as the post_id array values.

Array (

'post_id' => array(category_object, category_object) ,'post_id' => array(category_object)

)

In 2.1 there seems to have been another layer of array added:

Array (

Array (

'post_id' => Array(category_object, category_object) ,'post_id' => Array(category_object)

)

)

I can't see the benefit of this extra layer, and it breaks backward compatibility.

If this is "broken" as I suspect, point me in the right direction and I'll try to create a patch.

item.title: Ticket #3426 (Should include default favicon) created
item.dc:creator: robertaccettura
item.description:
By default there should be a favicon. Some browsers (won't mention names) try and retrieve whatever is at /favicon.ico (for those of us who install wp at the root of the hostname. If wordpress handles 404's as well, you'll be wasting cpu/memory to serve up a 404 for not good reason. I guess it could be a wordpress logo, or just something generic like a white square (blank in the url bar) 100% transparent (does that work in all browsers?) or something else rather neutral.

It's rather wasteful on behalf of the UA, but I guess that's the way the cookie crumbles.

item.title: Ticket #2635 (edit-pages.php paging cuts off children) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
worksforme:

Not an issue for 2.1 or 2.0.5... they're both querying all pages.

2.1: 

SELECT   wp_posts.* FROM wp_posts  WHERE 1=1  AND (post_type = 'page' AND (post_status = 'publish' OR post_status = 'future' OR post_status = 'draft' OR post_status = 'private'))  ORDER BY menu_order DESC

2.0.5: 

SELECT * FROM wp_posts WHERE post_status = 'static'

item.title: Ticket #3354 (PHP 5.2 & Fatal error in cache.php) updated
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description:
We need an editing function: 

<?php
class Destruct {
    function Destruct() {
        return $this->__construct(); // forward php4 to construct
    }
    function __construct() {
        // register destruct method as shutdown function
        register_shutdown_function(array(&$this, "__destruct"));
        return true;
    }
    function __destruct() {
        // finish stuff
        return true;
    }
}
$obj = new Destruct();
?>

item.title: Ticket #3354 (PHP 5.2 & Fatal error in cache.php) updated
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description:
You can also call destruct as a function in a class: <?php class Destruct {

function Destruct() {

return $this->construct(); forward php4 to construct

}

function construct() {

register destruct method as shutdown function register_shutdown_function(array(&$this, "destruct"));

return true;

}

function destruct() {

finish stuff return true;

}

}

$obj = new Destruct(); ?>

item.title: Ticket #3354 (PHP 5.2 & Fatal error in cache.php) updated
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description: That's weird, I can't do a double underline, that makes the text underlined. O well.

item.title: Ticket #3354 (PHP 5.2 & Fatal error in cache.php) updated
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description: Yeah, damn deconstuct. They marked the bug as bogus (even though it technically isnt), so I don't think it's getting fixed in the PHP. You can sorta fix it by calling register_shutdown_function on destruct, but destruct is still messed up. Although it gets rid of the error.
